page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: The area is served by minor metalled roads and by many unsurfaced tracks. The main route between Sheffield and Manchester runs along the southern border and is the only 'A' class road. The tracks over the moorland are relics of quarrying days,but most of the rough land is not tracked. Parallel to the 'A' road,and approx.0.5 km.north of it is the old coach route,still bounded by stone walling set back from the present surface.At Moscar Cross,it crosses a north/south old road,and this location is mentioned in the classic novel {Jane Eyre.} There are only 2 bus services,one along the 'A' road being twice daily to Bamford and Derwent.
